name: Network Toolbox
body: ### Welcome to the Network Toolkit. The Network Toolkit provides various resources for automating network services used in enterprise, internet providers, and within the cloud space. ### Valet Valet, our first tool in the stack, simply abstracts communicating with network devices into a service with a simple API. This abstraction is powerful, allowing a central location of access control to all automations. Throw away your individual scripts that all implement slightly different methods for sending command, configurations, or files to your network device. Built for scale, this service scales to thousands of nodes and is perfect for your kubernetes/docker installation. And security doesn't take a backseat. Certificate support built in for service access and user/pass or SSH keys for device access (user/pass, can you believe still a necessary evil in 2016). ### Built on Go All tooling in the Network toolkit is built in the Go language. Go is fast, scalable and easy to deploy (no need to install an interpreter). This makes installing toolkit components much easier. If your not familiar with Go, more information can be found at: http://www.golang.org . There is a very small but growing number of network automation tooling frameworks written in scripting languages such as Python that plugin to larger frameworks such as Ansible (also in Python). All services are exposed via Google's GRPC library, allowing all major languages access to the infrastructure. We currently only provide client wrappers in Go, but will extend them to other libraries in the future. ### Licensing Everything here is licensed via the Apache 2.0 license. This project utilizes other open source software whose licenses may vary. While we try to maintain compatible licenses, we make no guarantees and it is the user's responsibility to check on any licensing requirements they may have. ####Here is a current list of third-party libraries and their licenses: golang libraries(ssh, context, ...) - BSD license(https://golang.org/LICENSE) grpc libraries - BSD license(https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/LICENSE) glog - Apache 2.0(https://github.com/golang/glog/blob/master/LICENSE) pflag - BSD license(https://github.com/spf13/pflag/blob/master/LICENSE) ### Authors and Contributors Author - John Doak (@johnsiilver)
